meanings.definition: Bring oneself into favor with someone by flattering or trying to please them.
meanings.sent1: She ingratiates herself with the teacher by always offering to help with tasks.
meanings.sent2: He ingratiates himself with his boss by complimenting her work ethic.
meanings.sent3: The cat ingratiates itself with the family by purring and rubbing against their legs.
meanings.sent4: The politician ingratiates himself with the voters by promising lower taxes.
meanings.sent5: The new employee ingratiates herself with her colleagues by bringing in homemade cookies.

meanings.definition: Act in a way intended to gain favor or approval.
meanings.sent1: The child ingratiates with his parents by cleaning his room without being asked.
meanings.sent2: She ingratiates with her friends by always being supportive and kind.
meanings.sent3: The puppy ingratiates with the family by wagging its tail and fetching the newspaper.
meanings.sent4: The artist ingratiates with the critics by incorporating their feedback into her work.
meanings.sent5: The student ingratiates with the teacher by participating actively in class discussions.
